results.title: Swami Shyam
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Our Asian neighbours: India”.
A guru and his followers live in an ashram in Kulu Valley, within the Himalayas. The audience is directly involved in experiencing an Indian swami. The film ends with one of the swami’s three minute lessons on meditation. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: Svadebka
results.creator_credit: RM Arts, Nederlandse Omroep Stichting and Hans Hulsher
results.brief_description: A studio recording of the renowned Netherlands Dance Theatre’s interpretation of Stravinsky’s Les Noces (Svadebka). Choreographed by Jiri Kylian, the piece pictures the ceremony of a traditonal Russian country wedding through a fusion of ballet with some contemporary influences. The dance engages with the rapid pace and intricate rhythms of Stravinsky’s score in a spirited evocation of the mystery of marriage, both its beauty and apprehension, particularly for the bride to be.

results.title: Suzi's story
results.creator_credit: Carlyon-Gillespie Production, Pro-image and Iain E. Gillespie
results.brief_description: This is the true story of the Lovegrove family. It is the story of Suzi, a loving wife and mother stricken with AIDS. This documentary poignantly deals with this tragic and deadly virus, and seeks to educate the viewer about the debilitating effects of AIDS not only on the victim, but on those who love her. This film sensitively brings home the reality of AIDS. It won’t easily be forgotten.

results.title: Suzdal
results.brief_description: A tour of the unique museum-town of Suzdal. This town, a treasure of Russian culture, is the home of more than seventy architectural masterpieces of the 13th to the 19th centuries. Introduction and some credits in English. Remainder of film musical background only.

results.title: Susso kids
results.brief_description: Crops might just as well be ploughed into the ground or left to rot in the sun! From Black Thursday, October 1929, Australian productivity had never been higher, but there was no market for it. This documentary depicts causes and effects of the Great Depression in Australia, using film clips of the period. Shows the divisive effect of the disparity in living conditions, attempts by the unemployed to improve their social and economic circumstances and the plight of the children. Linked by songs of the period. Commentary by Telford Jackson.

results.title: Suspects all
results.creator_credit: Ronald H. Riley, R.H.R. Productions, Film Producers Guild and Anthony Pelissier
results.brief_description: A dramatised fatal factory fire and its investigation shows how such accidents can result from carelessness, fire hazards such as litter, poor building design, overloaded electrical circuits and lack of fire drill for the staff.

results.title: Susan
results.creator_credit: Tom Manefield, Jason Ollivier and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Why can’t they be like we were?”.
Susan is the fifteen-year-old daughter of migrant parents and withwhom she is in conflict. She is trying to gain self-knowledge, and to sort out the problems she has with her parents, peer group and boyfriend.

results.title: Survivors of the Holocaust
results.creator_credit: Turner Original Productions, June Beallor, James Moll and Allan Holzman
results.brief_description: Chronicles the events of the Shoah (Holocaust) as witnessed by those who survived. This documentary combines archival footage with the survivor’s personal testamonies and photographs, describing life in pre-war Europe, the devastating impact of Nazism, the liberation of the concentration camps and life fifty years later. The impact of the survivor’s stories prompted Steven Spielberg to establish Survivors of the Shoah Visual History Foundation, a non-profit project to videotape tens of thousands of these personal accounts and make them available for education worldwide.

results.title: Surviving the Outback Rivers
results.brief_description: The vast Australian Outback has been described as a land of heroes and dead men. Join Scott Lambert and seven Australian army commandoes who are all recipients of the green beret on a three week rafting expedition, where enough provisions for one week have been taken, with the idea of “living off the land” for most of the time. Setting out from Darwin, the journey will take these adventurers down the Katherine River through the Katherine Gorge, then back through the Clarevale Crossing and the Daly River Crossing, back to Darwin. A fascinating adventure amongst some of the most beautiful wilderness in Australia.
